title: A Gemma Stone Cozy Mystery Series - Willow Monroe
description:
01. Mall Santa Murder [Gemma Stone Cozy Mystery, #1] - Willow Monroe
 
Gemma Stone normally hates the Black Friday shopping rush, but this year sheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s excited Ã¢â‚¬â€œ she and her best friend Holly have opened their very own jewelry boutique, and theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re pretty proud of it. The only downside might be that their fancy new mall kiosk is directly in front of Santa Land, the noisiest spot in the mall.

Santa is a drunk, the elves are kind of mean, and to top it off, security is left up to a wannabe cop who canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t pass the police academy entrance exam. As if that isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t enough, Gemma discovers Santa dead, propped up against a poinsettia and strangled with garland.

Suddenly everyone is a suspect, and Gemma canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t keep her nose out of police business. Things are getting dangerous, but even with handsome detective Ross Ferguson tracking her every move, Gemma has to solve this crime before she ends up dead.

02. Mantions Can Be Murder [Gemma Stone Cozy Mystery, #2] - Willow Monroe
 
Gemma Stone is excited about being invited to participate in this yearÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s fitness convention at the stately Northlake Manor Hotel. It will be a boon to her fledgling HealthGems company and a great way to spend some quality time with her best friend and business partner Holly.

The only glitch in the weekend plan is that when they get there, they discover that the convention center has overbooked (again). Now they have to share their space with aliens, crackpot authors, and the occasional horde of zombies, not to mention the hotel management Ã¢â‚¬â€œ three unpleasant siblings who are either crazy or mean.

When a four-star general turns up dead in the lobby, the chaos becomes pure madness, especially for Gemma. It seems the general was a con-man, his murderer was ingenious, and the only clue is GemmaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s business card, clutched in his cold, dead hand.

03. Cupid's Corpse [Gemma Stone Cozy Mystery, #3] - Willow Monroe
 
Gemma Stone isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t sure itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a great idea to spend ValentineÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Day with her ex-fiance Nick Gemma Stone isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t sure itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a great idea to spend a romantic ValentineÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Day with her ex-fiance Nick Leonard, even if she did promise - that had been way back at Christmastime, right after she solved her very first murder. She had clearly been out of her mind.

So when Nick gets an anonymous tip and suggests making it a working weekend instead, she jumps at the chance to go away with him to a fabulous lodge, have some fun, and maybe catch a small-time crook. But then small-time crime turns into big-time murder, and Gemma has to figure out who killed CupidÃ¢â‚¬Â¦and why.

And when her own love triangle hits a few snags, this may turn out to be GemmaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s worst ValentineÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Day ever.

04. Rear-View Murder [Gemma Stone Cozy Mystery, #4] - Willow Monroe
 
When Gemma needs a new car, she calls on her friend and one-time fiancÃƒÂ© Nick to help out. The used car salesman he finds sells her more than a Honda, though, and now Gemma has a dead body in the trunk, a sneaking suspicion of murder, and an entire police force who thinks that the victim is just another hooker.

Gemma knows better, and her search for answers takes her to the roughest part of town and inside the world of pimps, dirty senators, and one oddly threatening blues singer. Somebody murdered poor young Opal, and Gemma is determined to catch her killer
